txt.en:
'It has been a long season, but it looks as if your spores have finally grown! I took the liberty of tending to the field while you were away.... I have been growing mushrooms of my own alongside the ones that you planted in the spring.

'I have been trying to perfect my family's mushroom-growing techniques for a number of years, and it seems that I was unsuccessful once again. But look at me going on! Patience is the virtue that I have been advocating to you, and now it seems that I am in need of it the most!

'Your mushrooms grew hearty and strong, and you should be well rewarded for your farming prowess! While I won't give up my family recipe just yet, please take this black mushroom transplant. You can place it in your own garden and tend to it there. Who knows, maybe you will find the secrets that I have long been searching for!'
'Here are the black mushrooms that you planted in the spring. Do be careful with them. It would be a shame if you damaged them.'
You have waited a long time, but now it is finally harvesting season!\n\n<rgb=#FF0000> NOTE: This quest will be removed from your quest log when the event it is associated with ends. </rgb>
Amabel Redfern is near the Party Tree in Hobbiton.\n\nYou should speak to Amabel Redfern again to receive your black mushroom transplant.
